Pre-Game Insights: USA go into this game high on confidence, having shown heart against Canada and recently upsetting Bangladesh.
Pakistan could hardly say the same, struggling to get a proper training session in and facing a vulnerable unit.
Imad Wasim, specifically brought back to the squad for his US and Caribbean experience, is out due to injury.
Pakistan's opening combination of Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam appears their only viable option.
Aaron Jones would be a problem for any bowling side, especially against Haris Rauf, Pakistan's most in-form bowler in that phase.
Azam Khan, despite recent struggles, remains a key player for Pakistan, though his form is severely out of nick.
Pakistan are likely to select Shadab Khan for all-round potential, while Babar and Rizwan go back up top.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain delayed the game, forcing Pakistan to use makeshift indoor facilities for practice sessions.
The final T20I against England made brutally plain that there is no hiding place for Azam Khan.
Rain has stayed away since the World Cup began, with a full game expected on Thursday.
The wicket offered early seam movement in each of the first two games with decent bounce and carry.
